page.title: 17H.M.S. INSKIP
page.content: The station is built on 600 acres of land formally owned by Lord Derby.In 1941 it was an operational naval base called HMS Nightjar,in 1945 a general store for the ministry and in 1956 a RN wireless telegraph station.In 1966 it was commissioned HMS INSKIP.It is our countrys premier naval H/F trans- mitting station communicating with the fleet, submarine service and N.A.T.O. The station has a complement of 55 officers and men and employs 21 local civilians. Married quarters are integrated with village housing and the establishment offers social facilities to the area. Playschool, Cubs, Scouts and youth club meet within the premises. The land is let to 5 agricultural tenancies for stock grazing and grass crops.
